description.narrative: The IFC will provide a financial facility to Credins Bank (the Bank) to finance projects for investment in energy efficiency (EE) and renewable energy (RE) in Albania. IFC is considering supporting the project with financing from the Canada Climate Change Program, a donor-funded facility for climate change friendly projects. IFC also provides advisory services (AS) to the Bank in financing of housing EE renovations in Albania and will consider enhancing its existing AS support with this project.

The Project is expected to generate a range of environmental and economic benefits related to the development of sustainable energy finance and related investments. The development impact of the Project is expected to be significant in the following areas: * improving the competitiveness of the Albanian economy by increasing the efficiency of energy use across sectors, * facilitating the development of energy efficiency investments among residential and potentially SME clients and targeting to generate a minimum decrease in per unit energy consumption >15% (kWh/unit (m2, production). * increasing lending for RE projects in Albania, with specific focus on small hydro power plants, provided that at least EUR 15 million would be financed, and app. app.15 MW newly installed * improving the local and global environment through decreased emissions of greenhouse gas and other conventional pollutants while reducing the country''s dependence on energy exports.
